p.k: Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah blends jazz fusion, hip-hop and alternative rock, developing a unique and distinct sound. Scott's performance at the 2017 edition of 'Jazz a Vienne' was one of the festival's highlights.
p.d: 'Jazz a Vienne' is one of the world's most prestigious jazz festivals. Ever since 1981, it has attracted leading jazz artists, with many of them playing return engagements. Unsurprisingly, the festival's 2017 edition did not fall short of expectations: the lineup was filled with the biggest names in music. One of them is Christian Scott aTunde Adjuah, a Grammy Award-nominee who played with artists such as Robert Glasper, Marcus Miller, and Thom Yorke. The American trumpeter blends jazz fusion, hip-hop and alternative rock, developing a unique and distinct sound. Scott's performance at the festival's main stage, the ancient Roman theatre, was one of 2017's festival highlight.
